skill.name: secrets-management
skill.description: Implement secure secrets management for CI/CD pipelines using Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or native platform solutions. Use when handling sensitive credentials, rotating secrets, or securing CI/CD environments.
skill.summary: Implement secure secrets management for CI/CD pipelines using Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or native ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Only documentation content was found, with examples for secrets tools and CI usage. No code paths show data theft, malicious execution, or hidden network activity.

content.value_statement: CI/CD pipelines often leak secrets through hardcoded values and logs. This skill guides you to store, rotate, and consume secrets safely with popular platforms.
actual_capabilities: Provides Vault setup and CI examples for GitHub Actions and GitLab CI
Shows AWS Secrets Manager create and retrieval steps
Explains GitHub Secrets and GitLab CI variables usage
Outlines secret rotation workflow with an AWS Lambda example
Includes Kubernetes External Secrets Operator sample manifests
Describes secret scanning with TruffleHog in pre-commit and CI
limitations: Does not provision or configure Vault, AWS, Azure, or GCP accounts
Examples require you to supply your own tokens and endpoints
No automated validation of secret values or policies
Reference files mentioned may be unavailable in this package

use_cases.title: Harden CI secrets
use_cases.description: Set up secure secret retrieval for build and deploy stages without hardcoded values.

use_cases.title: Define rotation flow
use_cases.description: Create a consistent secret rotation process and logging guidance for teams.

use_cases.title: Kubernetes secrets sync
use_cases.description: Model External Secrets Operator usage for cluster workloads.

prompt_templates.title: Basic secret storage
prompt_templates.scenario: New CI pipeline needs secret handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to store and use a database password in CI without hardcoding, using one platform from the skill.

prompt_templates.title: Vault in GitHub Actions
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft GitHub Actions steps that read two secrets from Vault and expose them as environment variables.

prompt_templates.title: AWS Secrets Manager flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline steps to create a secret and retrieve it in a CI job, including masking the output.

prompt_templates.title: Rotation design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a secret rotation workflow for a database, including update steps and validation checkpoints.

output_examples.input: Show a safe way to pull an API key into GitLab CI from Vault.
output: Use the Vault CLI in the job to fetch the key field
Export the key to a masked environment variable
Avoid printing the secret in logs
Rotate the key and update the Vault entry regularly

best_practices: Mask secrets in logs and outputs
anti_patterns: Reuse production secrets in test pipelines
Echo secrets to logs for debugging

faq.question: Which CI platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Examples cover GitHub Actions and GitLab CI, plus general steps for other platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples, not automated provisioning or policy enforcement.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Vault or AWS Secrets Manager?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes example steps for Vault and AWS Secrets Manager usage.

faq.question: Does it access my secrets or send data out?
faq.answer: No, it does not run code or access your environment.

faq.question: What if a command in the example fails?
faq.answer: Check tool installation, credentials, and endpoint URLs, then retry with minimal output.

faq.question: How does this compare to using plain CI secrets?
faq.answer: It adds stronger rotation and centralized control compared to basic CI variables.
